text: ...that the Races Table can show more information than it does by default?
For example, you could show DR Points, like this:
Right-click anywhere in the Races Table, and click "Select Columns" in the popup menu.
Use this dialog to show and hide columns, or even re-order the columns if you want.
...that these "$bb$Did You Know$/bb$" tips are displayed automatically, the first time you run $gt$ each day?
Usage Tips:
<ul $ul1$>
• Use the "$bb$Don't auto-show this tip again$/bb$" checkbox (below) if you don't want to see this specific tip anymore at startup.
• Once this checkbox is checked for all the tips, you won't see tips at startup, until a new tip is released.
• You can view all the tips anytime you want, by clicking the "$bb$Menu$/bb$" drop-down, and selecting "$bb$Did You Know?$/bb$".
...that a lot of the race tracks in $gt$ have detailed maps?
If the track has an animated map showing, move your cursor over the map. If it changes to a "hand" cursor, like this:
click on the animated map and the detailed map will pop up, like this:
I hope to be adding and updating more maps with each week's Data Updates. So if you see a Data Update with new or updated maps, make sure to check it out.
...that you can add your own custom fields, for tracking things like your best Qualifying Time, or any penalties you incurred during the race?
To add or edit Custom Fields, click the "$bb$Menu$/bb$" drop-down, and select "$bb$Edit Custom Fields$/bb$".
Click the "$bb$Help$/bb$" button there, for more information.
...that you can resize columns?
Hover the mouse over the edge of a column until the cursor turns into something like this:
Then drag it left or right to resize the column.
If you make the column too narrow for the text, then release the mouse button, the text will word-wrap in the column like this:
...that you can move columns around?
Use your mouse to drag a column left or right:
You can also use the "Select Columns" dialog to move columns, as shown in tip #1.
...that you can sort tables on multiple columns?
To sort on a single column, click the column once. The "▲" symbol appears, indicating the column is sorted ascending:
Click it again, and it sorts descending, as shown by the "▼" symbol:
Click it once more, and it goes back to the normal sort order:
To sort on additional columns, hold down the shift key when clicking another column:
...that you can filter the tables on various values?
If you don't already see the pink filter fields, right-click somewhere in the table, and select "$bb$Filter$/bb$" then "$bb$Show Header Filters$/bb$".
Click in a filter field and type in a condition, like "$bb$>1$/bb$":
Click in another filter field and add another condition, like "$bb$=1$/bb$":
For more information, click in a filter field and press $bb$F1$/bb$.
...that that's all the tips I have for now? Well, it is.
If I think of any more, I'll be sure to include them in a future Data Update.
If you have any ideas on tips for features people might otherwise miss, email me and I'll consider them.
Thanks!
